name: Sesame Seed
description: Sesame seeds are one of the oldest oilseed crops, cultivated over 3,000 years ago! They’re incredibly drought-resistant, perfect for warm climates.

name: Winter Melon
description: Despite its name, winter melon grows in warm seasons. It’s a staple in Asian cuisine and can grow up to 50 pounds!

name: Bottle Gourd
description: Bottle gourd can be used as both food and a container when dried. In ancient times, it was used as a water bottle!

name: Sponge Gourd
description: Sponge gourds are also known as luffas. When fully mature, they make great natural sponges for exfoliating skin.

name: Squash
description: Squash is one of the oldest cultivated crops in the Americas, dating back over 10,000 years!

name: Tomato
description: Tomatoes are a great source of vitamins A, C, and K. They are easy to grow and require full sunlight for optimal growth.

name: Eggplant
description: Eggplants belong to the same family as tomatoes and potatoes. They were once called "mad apples" in Europe!

name: Lima Beans
description: Known as “butter beans” for their creamy texture, lima beans were cultivated in Peru over 4,000 years ago.

name: Peanuts
description: Peanuts aren’t actually nuts; they’re legumes! They grow underground and are a rich source of protein.

name: Hyacinth Beans
description: This bean has a beautiful purple flower, often used as an ornamental plant. It’s both pretty and edible!

name: String Beans
description: Also called “green beans,” these are harvested before their seeds fully develop, making them tender and delicious.

name: Winged Beans
description: Winged beans are entirely edible, from leaves to roots, making them incredibly versatile.

name: Jicama
description: Often called the "Mexican turnip," jicama is crunchy and sweet, a perfect addition to salads.

name: Radish
description: Radishes grow super fast, often ready to harvest in just 3-4 weeks. Perfect for impatient gardeners!

name: Ginger
description: Known for its spicy, aromatic flavor, ginger is one of the healthiest spices, packed with anti-inflammatory properties.

name: Mustard Green
description: Mustard greens pack a punch! They are spicy and peppery, with more vitamin C than oranges.

name: Onion
description: Onions are ancient! They were eaten by Egyptian pyramid builders for strength and endurance.

name: Garlic
description: Garlic is a natural antibiotic and immune booster. Ancient Greeks used it as a performance enhancer in the original Olympic games!

name: Hybrid Sesame Seed
description: This unique sesame seed can produce oil with enhanced health benefits and is highly drought-resistant.

name: Hybrid Winter Melon
description: This super melon is packed with antioxidants and is known to last for months after harvesting.

name: Hybrid Bottle Gourd
description: Known for its versatility, it can be used as a musical instrument when dried!

name: Hybrid Sponge Gourd
description: This hybrid produces durable luffas, perfect for eco-friendly skincare routines.

name: Hybrid Squash
description: Hybrid squash varieties have extended shelf lives and are ideal for both culinary and ornamental uses.

name: Hybrid Tomato
description: This tomato variety has extra resistance to pests and diseases, making it a top pick for sustainable gardening.

name: Hybrid Eggplant
description: Known for its striking color and high nutrient content, this eggplant is packed with antioxidants.

name: Hybrid Lima Beans
description: These beans are larger, creamier, and loaded with protein, ideal for hearty dishes.

name: Hybrid Peanuts
description: This peanut variety yields extra-large nuts with a rich flavor, perfect for peanut butter lovers.

name: Hybrid Hyacinth Beans
description: Known for its vibrant color, this bean variety is both a beauty and a powerhouse of nutrients.

name: Hybrid String Beans
description: These beans grow in longer pods and are packed with vitamins A, C, and K.

name: Hybrid Winged Beans
description: This rare variety has an even higher protein content, perfect for vegetarian diets.

name: Hybrid Jicama
description: This hybrid has a sweeter taste and is packed with fiber, making it a perfect low-calorie snack.

name: Hybrid Radish
description: Known for its vibrant color, this radish is both beautiful and packed with antioxidants.

name: Hybrid Ginger
description: This variety is more aromatic and spicier, ideal for culinary uses and health benefits.

name: Hybrid Mustard Green
description: With a stronger flavor, this mustard green packs an extra punch of vitamins and minerals.

name: Hybrid Onion
description: Known for its unique flavor, this onion variety brings extra zest to any dish.

name: Hybrid Garlic
description: This hybrid garlic is more potent and has higher allicin content, perfect for boosting immunity.
